definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: I seek no revenge on you, ' replied Heathcliff less vehemently. 'That's not the plan.
sentences.chinese: “我並不要對你報復，”希刺克厲夫回答，火氣稍減。

sentences.english: His fury moderated when he learned why she had done it.
sentences.chinese: 當他知道了她那樣做的原因時，他的火氣就消了。

sentences.english: I came home angry at losing my job and took it out on my wife.
sentences.chinese: 我因爲失業氣哼哼地回到家裏，把火氣全發給老婆了。

sentences.english: The anger is very big, estimated must hit several needles east winds only then to be possible to convalesce.
sentences.chinese: 火氣很大，估計要打幾針東風纔可以痊癒。

sentences.english: He was getting more and more angry.
Later, Honolulu softened toward the resolute old captain.
sentences.chinese: 漸漸地，火奴魯魯對剛愎的老船長的火氣消了。

sentences.english: Say natively to cure actually, "Internal heat " the expression that is pure sex bleb.
sentences.chinese: 其實對於醫生來說，“火氣”是單純性皰疹的表現。

sentences.english: A stomach volume in the finishing woo vanished.
sentences.chinese: 一肚子火氣在刀刻斧削中煙消雲散。

sentences.english: If Su's madam a listen to Lin Mei, quick temper"Sou Sou" of the at heart soars.
sentences.chinese: 蘇夫人一聽林媚的話，心頭的火氣“嗖嗖”上漲。
她的眼裏突然冒着火氣。

sentences.english: It was difficult to give credence to the report.
sentences.chinese: 把廚炊的煙火氣從衣服上去掉是很難的。

sentences.english: When he came home at night, his heart relenting and growing hot for love of her.
sentences.chinese: 晚上他回家時，火氣已消，燃起一股對她熾熱的愛。

sentences.english: You must rein in your temper .
Maybe Boyd will have smoothed her down by now.
sentences.chinese: 說不定博伊德已經把她的火氣平息下來了。

sentences.english: Please don't go in such a bad temper, you will only feel worse.
sentences.chinese: 請別老是那樣大的火氣，這樣你的情緒只會更壞的。

sentences.english: But when the tempers start to flare, step back and take a breather.
sentences.chinese: 但當火氣開始冒頭時，退下來歇口氣。

definition: to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
evil influence/unhealthy trend/(a person's) evil air/aura of wickedness/(TCM) pathogenic energy (opposite: 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4], vital energy)
to dwindle/to vanish/to make vanish/to exercise restraint/to curb (one's mirth, arrogance etc)/to astringe/(math.) to converge
when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
excess of internal heat due to poor general condition (TCM)/the prestige of another person, which one borrows for oneself
lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom)/fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction/minor details obscure the main point/the sauce is better than the fish
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
